description: A fast breakdown of William Morris: The Grandfather of Bauhaus for builders.

hook.text: Before the Bauhaus existed, William Morris dreamed the same dream: beautiful objects for ordinary people.

discovery.text: Morris believed factory goods were ugly and soulless. Only handcraft could bring beauty to daily life.

twist.text: Handmade meant expensive. Morris's 'art for everyone' was affordable only for the wealthy.

climax.text: Morris proved the desire was real â€” but his method failed. The Bauhaus would solve what Morris couldn't.

punchline.text: Morris wanted beauty for all. The Bauhaus figured out how.

quiz.question: Why did William Morris's Arts and Crafts movement fail commercially?
options: Handmade objects were too expensive for ordinary people
